meta.purpose: UI/UX mockup for a weekly TV schedule/TV Guide grid page showing shows scheduled across the week
meta.notes_for_model: This is the weekly planning view - a visual TV Guide that lets families see and manage their entire week's viewing. It should feel like a beautiful wall calendar meets a cinema marquee. The grid shows days as rows with time-based columns, and show blocks positioned by their scheduled time.

story.one_sentence_brief: A sophisticated weekly schedule grid showing Monday through Sunday as rows with time slots as columns, where colorful genre-coded show blocks with poster thumbnails and episode info are positioned along a timeline, with a glowing current-time indicator on today's row.
story.additional_context: This is the 'control room' for household TV coordination. Families plan their whole week here, assigning shows to specific days. The design needs to be both informative and beautiful - functional data visualization with cinema aesthetics.

scene.subject: A full-width weekly schedule grid interface with a sticky time header row showing hours (5PM-12AM), seven day rows (Monday-Sunday) with day labels on the left, and colorful show blocks positioned along the timeline. Each show block has a small poster thumbnail, title, and episode number. A vertical red/crimson line with glow effect marks the current time on today's row.
secondary_subjects: Page header with 'Weekly Schedule' title and week navigation arrows
Time markers at top (5 PM, 6 PM, 7 PM, etc.)
Day labels sticky on left (Monday, Tuesday, etc.) with date
Gold 'Today' indicator dot next to the current day
Floating gold FAB button in bottom-right for 'Add Show'
Genre-colored show blocks (drama=dusty rose, comedy=gold, action=terracotta, sci-fi=steel blue)
scene.action: Static UI mockup showing the weekly schedule with multiple shows distributed across different days
scene.location: Digital web browser frame showing the schedule page at desktop resolution with horizontal scroll capability
scene.time_of_day: The interface suggests evening viewing times (schedule shows 5PM-12AM range)
scene.mood: Organized and satisfying, like looking at a well-planned week - control and anticipation combined

composition.shot_type: Full page screenshot/mockup view showing the complete weekly schedule grid
composition.camera_angle: Straight-on, flat UI presentation view with slight horizontal scroll visible
composition.framing: Header at top, time row sticky below, day rows fill the main content area. The grid extends horizontally suggesting scrollable timeline. Day labels anchor the left side.

style.medium: High-fidelity digital UI design mockup with data visualization elements
style.era_or_reference: Classic TV Guide grid reimagined with streaming service polish - like if the Sunday newspaper TV grid was designed by Apple
style.color_palette: Deep night background (#0D0F14), alternating row backgrounds, genre-coded show blocks (dusty rose #8B4D6B for drama, gold #D4A853 for comedy, terracotta #C25B4D for action, steel blue #4D7B8B for sci-fi), velvet crimson (#8B2942) for current time indicator, warm white text

lighting.description: Dark background with show blocks providing color interest. The current time indicator has a subtle glow effect. Sticky headers have glass effect with subtle blur. Show block hover states would show enhanced shadows.
lighting.color_and_contrast: High contrast between dark background and colorful show blocks. Time indicator stands out with crimson glow. Day labels clearly readable against darker left column.

format.surface_or_output: Desktop web browser mockup at 1920x1080 or higher, suitable for design presentation

elements.style: Playfair Display, 600 weight, page title size, warm white
DM Sans, regular weight, muted cream

elements.placement: Header right side, week date range
Time header row, first major time marker
elements.style: JetBrains Mono, micro text, hint gray

elements.placement: First day row label, sticky left column
Inside a show block on the grid
elements.style: DM Sans, 600 weight, warm white (or dark if light genre color)
JetBrains Mono, small, slightly transparent white

elements.placement: Current time indicator pill at top of the time line
elements.style: JetBrains Mono, micro, white on velvet crimson pill

constraints.factual_accuracy: Schedule grid should have proper alignment and time calculations. Show blocks should be realistically sized based on typical show runtime (30-60 min). Days should be in correct order.
constraints.safety_and_rights: Use generic show titles or clearly fictional shows. No real show logos or copyrighted imagery.
negative_elements: no tiny show blocks that can't be read
